alert.note: Alert for Bennington; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 1:54PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bennington County through 230 PM EDT... At 154 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mount Tabor, or near Londonderry, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Peru, Sherwood Forest, North Landgrove, Freedleyville, Peru Town Center, French Hollow, Landgrove Town Center, Bromley Village, North Dorset and East Dorset. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern Vermont.
